intro: Ruellia galeottii, commonly known as the Florida ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular, blue to purple flowers. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is often found in swampy or seasonally flooded areas. Ruellia galeottii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
